intro: Papaver obtusifolium, commonly known as the blunt-leaf poppy, is a species of flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of the Caucasus and the Tien Shan. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broad and rounded. Its flowers are showy, with bright red petals that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
